input_text:
Job Title: Product Manager

Location: Madison, WI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Product Management

Description:
Recognized as a Milwaukee Journal Sentinel Top Workplace for 12 consecutive years, including three years of being honored as number one! Join us at West Bend, where we believe that our associates are our greatest asset. We hire talented individuals who are conscientious, dedicated, customer focused, and able to build lasting relationships. We create and maintain an environment where you feel a sense of belonging and appreciation. Your diversity of thought, experience, and knowledge are valued. We’re committed to fostering a welcoming culture, offering you opportunities for meaningful work and professional growth. More than a workplace, we celebrate our successes and take pride in serving our communities.

Job Summary

This is a great opportunity for a candidate with Product Management experience!

Responsibilities & Qualifications

Summary of Responsibilities

 Monitor, evaluate and report on assigned line of business for profitability.  Oversee and support other lines of business as required.  Conduct market research and competitor analysis.  Develop and introduce new or enhanced insurance products for assigned lines of business.  Collaborate with other areas on proposed bureau changes and annual rate review.  Research and develop new forms, proposed form changes and draft manuscript endorsements when required.  Provide support and technical training to underwriters and manager/supervisors for new and existing products or forms.  Maintain agents’ manuals and internal commercial enterprise reference manuals.  Provide underwriting requirements for development of on-line based rating and application submission systems.  Assist with reinsurance questions and implementation of changes due to revisions in reinsurance contracts.  Collaborate with other areas in the assessment of training needs at a team level and research and prepare technical articles and training materials.  Work with a greater degree of independence and assist or lead in other departmental projects.  Strong leader and role model within team. Maintains and leverages strong relationships at various levels of organization.  Handles special project work as assigned.  Provide input & guidance on the use of analytics within Commercial Enterprise.  Works closely with Commercial Enterprise Leadership to ensure profit and growth objectives align with Commercial Enterprise goals and strategies.  Engage with others to learn and understand industry trends and their effect on underwriting, claims, loss control and other areas of organization to make recommendations to Commercial Enterprise Leadership. 

Preferred Experience And Skills

 6+ years experience in commercial multi-line underwriting and 3+ years experience in product management  Leadership skills, with the ability to coach, mentor and develop others  Great oral & written skills  Strong Analytical and communication skills  Project Management skills  Organization and time management skills  Ability to perform highly detailed and analytical work 

Preferred Education And Training

 Bachelor's degree in Business, Insurance or related field  Completion of Associate in Underwriting program and CPCU and/or CIC 

 EEO 

West Bend provides equal employment opportunities to all associates and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, and promotion.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

output_json.title: Product Manager
output_json.summary: Join West Bend, a recognized Top Workplace, where your diversity of thought, experience, and knowledge are valued.
preferred_degrees: Bachelor's degree in Business, Insurance or related field

Support other lines of business as needed
Conduct market research and competitor analysis
Develop and introduce new or enhanced insurance products
Collaborate on bureau changes and annual rate reviews
Research and develop new forms and manuscript endorsements
Provide support and training to underwriters and managers
Maintain agents' manuals and internal reference manuals
Assist with reinsurance questions and changes
Prepare technical articles and training materials
Work independently and assist in other projects
Lead by example within the team
Ensure alignment with Commercial Enterprise goals
Collaborate with leadership on analytics usage
